alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:28PM EST until February 17 at 8:27PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. Water begins inundating Wolverine Road just north of the Hays Depot bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 29.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EST Friday was 29.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 4.5 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.2 feet on 03/18/1973. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 9 PM EST Friday.
